author: cbc
title: Conservative leadership debate to take place on Montreal's West Island
text:
Conservative Party leadership hopefuls will have another chance to showcase their bilingualism after a rocky French-language debate in January â€” and this time, Kevin O'Leary will be there with them.
Gloves come off in French-language   debate Twelve of the 14 candidates vying for the leadership of the federal Conservative Party will be debating in the Montreal-area municipality of Pointe-Claire, Que., on Tuesday night.
High-profile candidates Kellie Leitch and Kevin O'Leary have confirmed their attendance at the debate, which is hosted by the Pierrefonds-Dollard Conservative riding association. 
The only candidates expected to be absent this evening are Deepak Ohbrai and Brad Trost. Both have scheduling conflicts.
Eyes on 'Mr. Wonderful' The bilingual debate is one of the first opportunities for O'Leary, who announced his candidacy one day after the French-language debate , to showcase his fluency in a second language.
OPINION: Is this   thing over yet? The event starts at 7 p.m. ET.
More than a dozen questions have been submitted by party members. Each question will go to three leadership candidates. If the question is not addressed to specific debaters, the moderators will pick three candidates to answer the question,
Candidates will  have a minute each to respond, and each candidate will be granted five opportunities to jump in for a maximum of 45 seconds.
Conservative Party members will elect a leader on May 27.
